Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use the database.
Design the database architecture, including the choice of single server or flexible server deployment, storage options, and high availability configurations.
Choose the appropriate pricing tier based on performance requirements, storage needs, and budget constraints.
Create and configure the PostgreSQL server in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Specify the region, compute resources, and storage settings.
Set up firewall rules to allow access to the database server from specific IP addresses or virtual networks.
Configure high availability options, such as zone-redundant deployments or read replicas, to ensure database resiliency.
Enable security features such as SSL enforcement, data encryption at rest, and role-based access control (RBAC).
Set up automated backups and test restore procedures to ensure data recovery in case of failure.
Configure performance tuning options, such as query optimization, indexing, and caching, to meet application requirements.
Perform thorough testing of database connectivity, query execution, and application integration to ensure proper functionality.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools to track database performance, availability, and security.
Document the database architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the database.
Ensure the database setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
